isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - REMOVE - NEUTRAL SWITCH TROUBLESHOOTING

note.para: If the ohmmeter responds as indicated in the test procedure, do not perform this procedure as the switch is in good working condition.

step1.para: Remove the switch using a 22 mm or 7/8 inch deep well socket or box end wrench.
Check for the presence of the neutral pin in the bore under the switch.

While watching the neutral pin, move the transmission shifter between the center neutral position and any gear. The pin should raise up when the transmission is in gear and lower when the transmission is in neutral. If the pin does not raise and lower properly, remove the pin with a magnet and check it for wear. Also, remove the shift bar housing and check the shift shaft for wear.
Remove the pin from the bore with a magnet and check it for excessive wear. If it is worn, replace it.
If the pin is present and not worn, replace the switch with a new one.
